newsitem.title: USA: Raptor, Open Market in alliance.
newsitem.headline: Raptor, Open Market in alliance.

text.p: Raptor Systems Inc and Open Market Inc said on Tuesday they formed an alliance under which Raptor will pay $6 million for the worldwide rights to market and distribute Open Market's Axcess access control software.
Raptor also agreed to make its Eagle family of firewall products available to Open Market's Transact Internet commerce software customers.
The intent is to give Raptor, a network security company, the ability to let customers control network connections as well as information access.
Open Market, of Cambridge, Mass., would focus on its core Internet commerce software products, with the additional benefits of network security offerings, the companies said.
The Axcess product is intended to provide secure, centralized access control to distributed Web-based content such as sales information and distributor cost schedules.
Raptor shares were down 3/8 to 14-1/8 in afternoon trading. Open Market was up 1/8 to 9-5/8.
